column4: can someone tell me how to install a .deb file through terminal real quick please?
sudo dpkg -i filename.deb
k thanks, what's dpkg mean and is there a site what shoes all the letters mean? like, in loop -o and mount -t, dkpg -i
i dunno, but kde has the man:/ kioslave
meaning you can just go to man:/dpkg in konqueror
ah i see
you can use man itself, but I prefer the pretty version
yes, there are 2 great ones
tintin++ or tinyfugue
it seems i need python2.2
oh, so no need for something besides MCL?
well, neither of them will install unless i have python 2.2. I'm trying to play Medievia
tintin++ has no need for python, I'm fairly sure
i mean, last I checked it was written in plain C
you are right
hmm, silly question, where did tintin++ install to? the command itself doesn't launch it
tt++
that's the reason we have command-not-found or whatever, some commands are not the same as package names
make sure you have universe componten enabled
so tt++ does not run even though you did install of tintin++?
yup ;\
